categories.name: Reactive Problem Solving & Support
categories.description: Recognition focused on immediate, often urgent, responses to unexpected issues, errors, or time-sensitive needs.

subcategories.name: Urgent Technical/System Fixes
subcategories.description: Addressing immediate bugs, errors, hotfixes, or system failures, often outside normal hours.
examples: prep the hotfix and navigated through the approval process
help in resolving the Revenue Recognition data population issues

subcategories.name: Handling Time-Sensitive Requests
subcategories.description: Responding quickly and efficiently to urgent operational or client requests that require immediate action.
examples: support and respect for urgency of late
responded so quickly with the utmost discretion

subcategories.name: Unblocking/Troubleshooting Assistance
subcategories.description: Providing direct help to unblock a colleague's work, often involving deep knowledge or investigation.
examples: help me find answers buried deep in documentation
collaborate recreating the issue and providing specific details

categories.name: Proactive Project & Delivery Excellence
categories.description: Recognition for high-quality execution, ownership, and successful completion of planned projects, initiatives, or foundational work.

subcategories.name: Significant Deliverable Completion
subcategories.description: Achieving major milestones, launching products, or delivering foundational work that has a large impact.
examples: delivering the initial Out-of-the-Box Spend 2.0 UI
successfully delivering the Budget Management 2.0 fix

subcategories.name: Ownership and Momentum Maintenance
subcategories.description: Taking full responsibility for a task or area, especially during transitions or when others are absent, ensuring continuity.
examples: stepped up and keeping momentum strong—you made the handoff seamless
taking ownership of the problem, driving home the fix

subcategories.name: Quality and Attention to Detail
subcategories.description: Praise for thoroughness, accuracy, and high standards applied to deliverables or processes.
examples: attention to detail with focus towards bringing great value to our users
Your questions are a reflection of the care you take in helping our customers

categories.name: Collaboration and Partnership
categories.description: Recognition centered on how individuals interact with others, emphasizing teamwork, relationship building, and cross-functional support.

subcategories.name: Cross-Functional Support
subcategories.description: Helping teams outside the immediate group or providing support across different functional areas.
examples: incredible collaboration over the past few months
support you and the BDR team provided in helping to generate registrations

subcategories.name: Teamwork and Mutual Support
subcategories.description: General appreciation for being a reliable teammate who contributes positively to the group dynamic.
examples: support, teamwork, and positive energy you've brought throughout the year
willingness to step in whenever I needed support

subcategories.name: Client/Vendor Relationship Management
subcategories.description: Excellence in external partnership, communication, and maintaining positive stakeholder relationships.
examples: wonderful partner to your clients
amazing partnership - not just for the recent company meeting

categories.name: Knowledge Sharing and Development
categories.description: Recognition for efforts dedicated to teaching, mentoring, sharing expertise, and fostering growth in others.

subcategories.name: Mentorship and Guidance
subcategories.description: Formal or informal coaching, sharing of best practices, and helping newer team members grow.
examples: being the best mentor I could ask for
thanks for all your mentorship and leadership this last sprint

subcategories.name: Sharing Critical Expertise
subcategories.description: Being the go-to expert whose knowledge unblocks strategic thinking or complex problem-solving.
examples: your deep knowledge and expertise, you're the person everyone turns to
highly valuable wisdom you share

categories.name: Sustained Positive Influence & Culture
categories.description: Recognition for consistent behavioral contributions that improve team morale, uphold values, or drive long-term positive change.

subcategories.name: Cultural Energy and Positivity
subcategories.description: Bringing enthusiasm, a positive mindset, or specific energy that uplifts the team environment.
examples: bring the BEST energy into every room
always with a positive mindset

subcategories.name: Upholding Values/Ethics
subcategories.description: Recognition for embodying core company values through actions, especially regarding respect or integrity.
examples: embody the company value 'Respect for All'
professionalism and support this week and last

subcategories.name: Consistency and Reliability
subcategories.description: Being consistently dependable, hardworking, and showing high levels of commitment over time.
examples: your hard work, reliability, and support throughout the year
continually impressed by your drive and will to achieve

categories.name: Personal Milestones & Occasions
categories.description: Recognition tied to personal life events or formal organizational achievements outside of standard project work.

subcategories.name: Life Events Recognition
subcategories.description: Acknowledging personal milestones such as birthdays or the arrival of a new baby.
examples: Congratulations on winning the Best Overall Innovation Award
Congratulations on the arrival of your beautiful baby boy

subcategories.name: Program/Development Completion
subcategories.description: Celebrating successful completion of formal training, development programs, or specific team events.
examples: Leadership Development Program graduates!
bringing the designers together in such warm and festive ways

reasoning: The messages heavily emphasize immediate, reactive support (C1) and the successful execution of complex projects (C2), which are distinct from general teamwork. Collaboration (C3) captures the 'how' of working together, while Knowledge Sharing (C4) addresses the transfer of skills. Finally, Culture/Consistency (C5) covers the behavioral aspects that sustain the team environment, separating them from one-off events (C6).
